doc.long_description:
This script allows the user to inspect a file or a directory
and extract all the most relevant information, such as documentations,
classes (and their methods), functions, etc.

To extract information from docstrings, we have started with the codes
documented. But in the future we will extend the code
to support others.  

This tool accepts (for now) only python code (.py)

This script requires `ast`, `cdmcfparser` and `docsting_parse`
be installed within the Python environment you are running 
this script in.
doc.full:
Code Inspector

This script allows the user to inspect a file or a directory
and extract all the most relevant information, such as documentations,
classes (and their methods), functions, etc.

To extract information from docstrings, we have started with the codes
documented. But in the future we will extend the code
to support others.  

This tool accepts (for now) only python code (.py)

This script requires `ast`, `cdmcfparser` and `docsting_parse`
be installed within the Python environment you are running 
this script in.

doc.short_description: init method initiliazes the Code_Inspection object

self.description: represent the instance of the class

doc.short_description: parse_file method parsers a file as an AST tree

self.description: represent the instance of the class

returns.description: the file as an ast tree

doc.long_description:
Those features are path, fileNameBase, extension, docstring
The method support several levels of docstrings extraction,
such as file's long, short a full descrition.
doc.short_description: inspec_file method extracts the features at file level.

self.description: represent the instance of the class

returns.description: a dictionary with the file information extracted

doc.long_description:
extracting the controlflow of a file. One as a
text and another as a figure (PNG/PDF/DOT).

self.description: represent the instance of the class

format.description: represent the format to save the figure

returns.description: a dictionary with the all information extracted (at file level)

doc.long_description: to _f_definitions method to extracts all the features at function level.
doc.short_description: inspect_functions detects all the functions in a AST tree, and calls

self.description: represent the instance of the class

returns.description: a dictionary with the all functions information extracted

doc.long_description:
and extracts their features. It also calls to _f_definitions method
to extract features at method level.

The features extracted are name, docstring (this information is further analysed
and classified into several categories), extends, start
and end of the line and methods.
doc.short_description: inspect_classes detecs all the classes and their methods,

self.description: represent the instance of the class

returns.description: a dictionary with the all classes information extracted

doc.long_description: Those features are module , name, and alias.
doc.short_description: inspect_dependencies method extracts the features at dependencies level.

self.description: represent the instance of the class

returns.description: a dictionary with the all dependencies information extracted

doc.long_description:
extracted from a given file such as, functions, classes 
and dependencies levels into the same dictionary.

It also writes this new dictionary to a json file.
doc.short_description: file_json method aggregates all the features previously

self.description: represent the instance of the class

returns.description: a dictionary with the all information extracted (at file level)

doc.long_description:
returns, raises of a list of functions or a methods.

Furthermore, it also extracts automatically several values
from a docstring, such as long and short description, arguments' 
name, description, type, default values and if it they are optional
or not.

self.description: represent the instance of the class

functions_definitions.description: represent a list with all functions or methods nodes

returns.description: a dictionary with the all the information at function/method level
